column5: Decided today to go for lake trout as the season is closing at the end of Sept.Had a tough time getting my boat in anƒè back on my trailer.It actually was touching the bottom.Got it out a bit deeper pushing with my paddle and was worse getting it back on my trailer but all worth it as i had a fantastic day.Plus the weather we have been having is like summer weather.Caufht around 2 dozen lakers today.62 ft seemed to be were they wanted to.Very aggressive bite today.If they came up to the lure they would smash it. Switched to hard to catch walleyes and figured I caufht a couple of dozen of them to.As with the trout the walleyes were all to big to keep.Ended keeping a 24" trout and brought one 20" walleye home.I was trying to get all of the species but that didn't happen.I did see 3 muskies today and had one of them on but it got off within 5 seconds.lol.Had a fun day.Only saw 2 boats near end of my day at 3 pm.
Quote: Originally Posted by Dave95Looks like a fun dayDefinatly got my trout fix
Do you do any guiding on Cliff? I have caught fish there in the winter but have never caught anything there in the summer.

Quote: Originally Posted by WrenchDo you do any guiding on Cliff? I have caught fish there in the winter but have never caught anything there in the summer.In a regular year I do a number of guided trips on Cliff Lake as well as ice fishing trips.
Quote: Originally Posted by WrenchHow can I contact youYes I do guide on Cliff.1-807-220-0860[email protected]
